title: DubemIfedigbo001
author: DubemIfedigbo001
content: Finally, I've observed that there are so much to learn in the forum, to the extent its sometimes overwhelming. There are so many intellectuals and professionals who display their wealth of knowledge at any concern. Its a good thing that there are people willing to create topics and contribute to meaningful topics created everywhere in the forum. I also observed the more I get engaged in the forum activities, the better I got at knowledge and exposure. I have resolved to learning and continuous learning to expand my knowledge personally and be able to grow to recognition in the forum one day in the nearest future. As fillipone rightly said in one of his posts, when you dedicate time to learning and readily share your knowledge with people in the forum, you grow not only in knowledge, but in the rewards of impacting meaningful knowledge "Merit". I'm now fully dedicated to continuous learning and contributions with a positive expectation of reaping the fruits of my labor pretty soon. A note to my fellow newbies(I'm definitely leaving that rank soon), keep learning and striving, everything we wish for will materialize.  But first, you've got to learn, learn and learn!!!.

comments.author: nelson4lov
comments.body: That's very well said. As with almost everything in life, learning is usually the first step before you can even put what you learn into practice (after building a solid KnowledgeBase that is).The forum has a gold mine of knowledge which is what made it standout to me vs other forums I visited at the time. Came researching researching about TBC: The Billion Coin but I stayed for the potential learning impact and it was one of the best decisions I've made in life.Btw, Goodluck on your journey.

comments.author: Ojima-ojo
comments.body: Good and nice one because learning is the partway to success in any field of life and for such you have chosen the right path to take by becoming a member of this forum, and as you have rightly said, bitcoin talk has become a home to many of us and we have learned a lot from other members of the forum and we also have offered knowledge in one way or the other but most importantly, the importance of building a good financial knowledge before you buy your first Bitcoin. And as long as you keep your activities up and running and engage in quality discussions that will impact you with quality knowledge that will guide you throughout your Bitcoin journey.

comments.body: OP, you are right about the forum. The more you become more active, the more knowledge that will get. Also when you have this knowledge, the more eddective you will be in discussion and from there you will grow in rank and get recognised by the dorum members based on you contributions.The forum is like a university that the money you study hard the better grades that you will get, and you will become recognized in your department or in your school. There are a lot here to learn that one can't learn everything in two years' time. As long as bitcoin is existing there will be new development in the technology and so many new features as time goes on. If you take the forum as a hobby, learning will become fun for you, and you will be happy with yourself.

comments.author: BitcoinPanther
comments.body: Indeed the forum have lots of knowledge to offer but we should be selective on the knowledge we have to learn.    Even though there are lots of genuine members that give their best to share the right and factual knowledge, there are also members that share half-baked knowledge which sometimes twist the factual truth about the subject matter.  We should always verify any knowledge we get in order for us to absorb the right one.  Like for example, some of the created thread here support that Craig Wright is Satoshi which in truth is a lie.  As a newbie rather than thinking things to type and post, it is much better to think of a good topic to read and learn.  This way newbies equipped with knowledge can be able to participate in the discussion brilliantly.

comments.author: Baghdad
comments.body: Reading and publishing, helps learning process any where it's been implemented. It works fine in this forum. I've seen quality threads, where the owner invests lots of time to create. I commend such people for their dedicated time in building a forum with useful information. The contents are free, surprising! Most top blogs demand for money before I can read. But here despite the high quality information contained in a thread, I read them and pay no dime. The journey of advancing in bitcoin knowledge is free and luckily the forum progress or ranks are organized to teach serious members. It's impressive to see the response of ranked members. Their knowledge is enormous and creates a learning environment for us, newbies. I'll keep learning gradually. The loads of information here, doesn't require fast reading. One might miss out on valuable details.

And once we learn something, let's not forget to share it to those who are in need.
